title: Dr Jonathan Batty
text:
My name is Dr Jonny Batty and I am an academic cardiology doctor, based in the Leeds Institute for Data Analytics (LIDA) at the University of Leeds. I am passionate about using routinely-collected healthcare data to better understand health and disease, and to build tools that can be used to improve clinical care.
During my PhD, I am using advanced statistical methods to explore the impact of different patterns of multiple long-term conditions in people diagnosed with acute myocardial infarction. This has kindly been funded by The Wellcome Trust and is supervised by Dr Marlous Hall, Principal Investigator of the Survivorship and Multimorbidity Epidemiology research group.
I’ll probably use this as a place to share code snippets, presentations, publications and other thoughts.

title: Dr Jonny Batty
text:
I’m an academic cardiology doctor, working in the NHS and based in the Multimorbidity and Survivorship Research Group, currently doing a PhD in the Leeds Institute for Data Analytics (LIDA) at the University of Leeds.
My PhD is supervised by Dr Marlous Hall, Dr Ben Brown and Prof. Mark Kearney.

My research interests include:

Cardiovascular disease
Patients with multiple long term conditions
The analysis of outinely-collected healthcare data
The application of advanced statistical methods and machine learning approaches
Applied causal inference techniques


Clinical Data Lab

title: Dr Jonny Batty
text:
Education
BSc(Hons) in Clinical Sciences in Relation to Medicine (2012) | University of Leeds, UK.
MBChB(Hons) in Medicine and Surgery (2014) | University of Leeds, UK.
MPH in Quantitative Methods (2017) | Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health, Harvard University, USA.
PhD in Medicine (expected 2025) | University of Leeds, UK.

title: Dr Jonathan Batty
text: I am a Specialty Registrar in Cardiology (ST6) with a subspeciality interest in coronary intervention. When I’m not in the Cath Lab or on the Coronary Care Unit, you’ll probably find me behind a computer, analysing data or trying to persuade a machine learning model to work.

title: Dr Jonathan Batty
text:
Other Indicators of Esteem
Peer review I regularly perform peer review of articles submitted to a number of journals. Recently, these have included (in alphabetical order): BMJ, BMJ Public Health, BMJ Student, Cardiology, Clinical Medicine, Diabetes and Vascular Disease Research, EHJ Case Reports, Heart, International Journal of Cardiology, Lancet, MedComm, and Systematic Reviews. Member of the UKRI Talent Peer Review College

title: Dr Jonathan Batty
text:
Other Indicators of Esteem
Peer review  I peer review for a number of journals. Recently, these have included (in alphabetical order): BMJ, BMJ Public Health, Cardiology, Clinical Medicine, Diabetes and Vascular Disease Research, EHJ Case Reports, Heart, International Journal of Cardiology, Lancet, MedComm, and Systematic Reviews.
The UKRI Talent Peer Review College I am a member of the [UKRI Talent Peer Review College(https://www.ukri.org/publications/ukri-talent-peer-review-college-member-list/) and have provided expert, independent, informed reviews of research proposals submitted to EPSRC for consideration for funding.
